TopicTitle: ISA MapSat High Quality Height Maps

Articles.Content:
Ok, just going to reuse this thread for a new question. Does anyone have some high quality ISA height maps for all the planets and moons? I know the Wiki has a few but they are from 18.2 so i'm not sure if they are all up to date.

Edited April 9, 2014 by Dr. Kriger
New Question

Its the Wiki what you seek:

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Main_Page

Its the Wiki what you seek:

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Main_Page

Yes thank you, I didn't even think to check there until I made this post and realized that KSP has a wiki.

Edited April 9, 2014 by Dr. Kriger
Many of the bodies are tidally locked to their parent planet, so a geostationary orbit is impossible as it would fall outside their SOI.
Original question has been changed to a new one.

Which makes it impossible for anyone else to understand the first 3 replies ^^

Do they have to be ISA maps? That mod is outdated and no longer supported itself, as far as I know. Its successor, SCANSat, is up to date though.
www.kerbalmaps.com Should have what you are looking for.

www.kerbalmaps.com Should have what you are looking for.

Yes thats exactly what I needed, thank you.
